page.title: 15Watford: Development
page.content:
The area now known as West Watford was at one time part of the Cassiobury Estate, owned by the Earls of Essex. In 1896 a Quaker bought a part of this estate, known as{Harwoods Farm}. At the time of the sale of this land for building, a restrictive covenant was included in the deeds to the effect that no public houses were to be built on the estate.
It is the opinion of some residents of the area that this has contributed to the fragmentation of community spirit, by removing any centres for meeting and for social activity.
